segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers

segment.source: The Windows Server 2008 server on which you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Web Service requires Internet Information Services (IIS) to be installed as a role on the server.
segment.target: The Windows Server 2008 server on which you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Web Service requires Internet Information Services (IIS) to be installed as a role on the server.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to configure Windows Server 2008 to support App-V server installation.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to configure Windows Server 2008 to support App-V server installation.

segment.source: To install IIS on a Windows Server 2008 computer
segment.target: To install IIS on a Windows Server 2008 computer

segment.source: On the Windows Server 2008 computer, click Start, click All Programs, click Administrative Tools, and then click Server Manager to start Server Manager.
segment.target: On the Windows Server 2008 computer, click Start, click All Programs, click Administrative Tools, and then click Server Manager to start Server Manager.

segment.source: In Server Manager, right-click the Roles node, and click Add Roles to start the Add Roles Wizard.
segment.target: In Server Manager, right-click the Roles node, and click Add Roles to start the Add Roles Wizard.

segment.source: In the Add Roles Wizard, on the Select Server Roles page, select Web Server (IIS).
segment.target: In the Add Roles Wizard, on the Select Server Roles page, select Web Server (IIS).

segment.source: When prompted, click Add Required Features to add the dependent features.
segment.target: When prompted, click Add Required Features to add the dependent features.

segment.source: On the Select Server Roles page, Click Next, and then click Next again.
segment.target: On the Select Server Roles page, Click Next, and then click Next again.

segment.source: In the Add Roles Wizard, on the Select Role Services page:
segment.target: In the Add Roles Wizard, on the Select Role Services page:

segment.source: Under Application Development, select ASP.NET and, when prompted, click Add Required Role Services to add the dependent roles services and features.
segment.target: Under Application Development, select ASP.NET and, when prompted, click Add Required Role Services to add the dependent roles services and features.

segment.source: Under Security, select Windows Authentication.
segment.target: Under Security, select Windows Authentication.

segment.source: In the Management Tools node, select IIS Management Scripts and Tools.
segment.target: In the Management Tools node, select IIS Management Scripts and Tools.

segment.source: Under IIS 6 Management Compatibility, ensure that both IIS 6 Metabase Compatibility and IIS 6 WMI Compatibility are selected, and then click Next.
segment.target: Under IIS 6 Management Compatibility, ensure that both IIS 6 Metabase Compatibility and IIS 6 WMI Compatibility are selected, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Confirm Installation Selections page, click Install, and then complete the rest of the wizard.
segment.target: On the Confirm Installation Selections page, click Install, and then complete the rest of the wizard.

segment.source: Click Close to exit the Add Roles Wizard, and then close Server Manager.
segment.target: Click Close to exit the Add Roles Wizard, and then close Server Manager.
